function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Disruption in work and movement of labor due to economic recession and covid-19 outbreak","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased workload on blue-collar workers due to the need for facility management services and creating a safer workplace for workers","category":"Workforce","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low client satisfaction and service quality in the indian construction and real estate sector","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low prevalence of lean construction and skilled contractors/workers","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Current covid-19 pandemic","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on mental health due to covid-19, including economic instability, domestic violence, and fear among healthcare workers","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in human activity leading to unattended and endangered species","category":"Environment","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Devastating global economic fallout from covid-19","category":"Economy","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic inequality leading to unequal access to resources such as stable homes, internet, and technology","category":"Socioeconomic","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to prioritize human health in sustainability goals","category":"Sustainability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global pandemic as a result of neglecting public health","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Separation of health from other sustainability goals","category":"Sustainability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient governance and stakeholder engagement in pandemic-focused urban planning","category":"Urban Planning","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of effective pandemic responses at the local government level","category":"Government","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of institutional coordination across multiple agencies and different jurisdictions","category":"Government","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ethical issues related to communicating risks and responses","category":"Ethics","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Allocation of scarce resources in socioeconomically different urban areas","category":"Socioeconomic","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of transparency and public understanding in decision making","category":"Government","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Oversimplification of biological systems in mathematical models","category":"Science","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Practicability and cost considerations of clinical testing and wastewater-based epidemiology wbe","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate testing capacity for a nation’s population may lead to slow and incomplete assessment of infection status, allowing for undetected spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High cost of individual clinical testing for large populations may limit the frequency and scope of testing, leading to delayed or incomplete identification of infected individuals.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited clinical testing capacity compared to population size may result in slow and costly screening processes, hindering effective assessment and management of contagious disease spread.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to wbe for certain regions and populations","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Wastewater-based epidemiology wbe may not fully replace clinical testing for covid-19 and may need to be used in conjunction with clinical testing.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations in global access to centrally collected wastewater for wbe may restrict its effectiveness in certain regions.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Diverting resources from clinical testing to wbe may affect the accuracy and timeliness of covid-19 surveillance and response.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Financial interests in startup companies related to the study’s intellectual space","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Founding a nonprofit project providing wastewater-based health assessments","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on ontologies for data standardization and knowledge representation poses a single point of failure risk.","category":"Technology","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of biomedical ontologies for studying coronavirus diseases","category":"Technology","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to align terms under basic formal ontology bfo","category":"Technology","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Development of cido-specific terms for covid-19 and other coronavirus diseases may lead to discrepancies in terminology and classification with existing ontologies.","category":"Technology","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Logical axioms and relations within the ontology may introduce errors or biases in representing disease processes and causation.","category":"Technology","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Identification of drugs with potential anti-coronavirus effects","category":"Medicine","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of ontology-based integration and analysis of anti-coronavirus drugs","category":"Medicine","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unregulated promotion of drugs based on information extracted from ontologies","category":"Medicine","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete coverage of drug information in existing ontologies","category":"Medicine","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient representation of vaccine information in ontologies","category":"Medicine","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of misinformation due to incomplete ontology-based approaches","category":"Medicine","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Historical pandemics recurring every 30 to 40 years","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of pandemics on the design of buildings and cities","category":"Architecture","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Introduction of quarantine facilities and sanitation policies","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changing living styles and uncertain conditions leading to the need for infectious disease-friendly building designs","category":"Architecture","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historically, pandemics have always had an impact on architecture.","category":"Architecture","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Human fear of infectious diseases has led to the emergence of artificial environments.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift in acceptable and radical policies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty about mainstreaming health criteria into public space design","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Economic challenges for sharing models and service providers due to hygiene concerns and additional costs","category":"Economy","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of decreased ridership on public transit due to fear of contagion","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"}]}
